question: Question_08_(b)
statement:
A player begins a game of chance by placing a marker in box 2, marked
start. A die is rolled, and the marker is moved one square to the left
if a 1 or 2 is rolled and one square to the right if a 3, 4, 5, or 6 is
rolled. This process continues until the marker lands in square 1, in
which case the player wins the game, or in square 4, in which case the
player loses the game.

\textbf{(b)} How would you check in MATLAB/Octave whether the above
stochastic matrix has only one eigenvalue equal to 1 or multiple
eigenvalues equal to 1? Write down the commands you would use and
explain how the output would indicate which of the possibilities is
true.
sols:
Input the following:

\texttt{~~~P~=~{[}1,1/3,0,0;0,0,1/3,0;0,2/3,0,0;0,0,2/3,1{]};}\\\texttt{~~~eigs(P)}

The \emph{eigs} command gives us a column vector listing the eigenvalues
of \emph{P}, including any repetitions. As such, if the value 1 appears
more than once in the output vector, then \emph{P} has multiple
eigenvalues equal to 1.
